description.value:
Reaving is the rarest manafont in Ardor. Unlike other manafonts, reavers can only sustain their ether by utilizing ether within living or spiritual beings – sometimes even the recently deceased -- or taking it for themselves. It is said that to accomplish this feat, their souls possess the power to reach out to ether through the souls or the blood of others. For this reason, they are often faced with prejudices of being corpse-eaters, vampires or ghouls, to the point where the stigma has disproportionately led reavers to ether deficiencies. However, on average reavers need to only consume fresh meat or vegetables (sometimes raw) to meet their needs, if they are not active. Adventuring reavers, however, need to be more creative.

Reaver Focus Point Feature

Reavers start with varying focus points after their daily preparations depending on the activities they take as part of it. These activities are similar to their Refocus activities, which include the consumption of food, communion to borrow ether from spirits, or absorption of ether from recently fallen corpses or remnants.

In general, consider the focus points they gain as equivalent to if they performed a Refocus activity, but with additional points up to their maximum depending on the quality of the rest and their activities. Fresher and fuller meals, more intentional drawing in of ether, or more meaningful communions will grant more points than normal.

Reaver Refocus

When Reavers refocus, they incorporate one of the below deeds as part of their Refocus. Depending on circumstance, these may require skill checks such as Survival (to subsist and find fresh food), or Arcana or Occultism (drawing in ether from corpses or remnants), or Nature or Religion (to commune with spirits) which would take up the ten-minute period. If they have ready access to any source for their focus points, they are free to perform other activities during the ten-minute period. At the end of the activity, they gain 1 focus point.

Refocus activities include:

  • Eating fresh meat, fruit or vegetables, which have not been heavily cooked/processed. Dried foods and general rations usually do not provide the sustenance required for a focus point.

  • Absorbing ether from a recent corpse, including undead or remnant remains.

  • Communing and borrowing power from any present spirits; you must be able to communicate with them in some fashion to entreat power from them in this way.

If you select a feat that improves your Refocus, you can gain an additional focus point in the ten-minute period by doubling up on an activity or performing multiple of the above activities.

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.ndVxIgrgVrMCQmga]{Drain Ether} (5th)

You can channel a connection another creature’s ether to pull it away from them to take it as your own. You learn the Drain Ether innate cantrip. As it is a cantrip, its spell level is automatically heightened to equal to half your level rounded up. You choose the spellcasting tradition of this cantrip. You can use either your strongest spellcasting DC or class DC for this cantrip. When you acquire this feature, choose which saving throw the cantrip will use. You can retrain this feature to change the saving throw after several weeks of downtime.

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.4wnej70ZfU9tWt1B]{Draw Soul} (10th)

You have become adept at drawing in ether from other creatures and the recently departed, making use of the power within while it retains its strongest potency. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.1ATKSEf1zPBfGODM]{Draw Soul} free action.

When you acquire a mote of ether from Drain Ether or Draw Soul, instead of immediately using it, you can stow it within you instead as a free action. Once stowed, you can later choose to use it as normal as a single Interact action. Alternatively, when you Cast a Spell using focus points, you can choose to make use of the stowed mote to negate up to 2 points of the focus point cost to cast the spell. You can only stow one mote at a time, and the mote dissipates after ten minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.pfGioFyyAy8C2gBb]{Soul Empathy} (15th)

You are able to gleam and acquire a faint trace of the creatures whose ether you’ve taken for your own. Whenever you acquire a mote of ether from a creature via Drain Ether or Draw Soul and choose to absorb it, you can choose to gain resistance to one type of damage equal to one of the creature’s resistances up to your level for one hour or until you use this feature again. If you know the creature’s resistances and it has multiple resistances, you can choose which one to acquire. You also can perform Recall Knowledge on the creature as a free action.
